_exec_summary.SummaryText:
At this facility we handle Anhydrous Ammonia which is considered hazardous by the Environmental Protection Agency.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal and State rules and regulations with regard to storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia.

The owners, management and employees of Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Sheldon are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur the facility is prepared to work with the responding Fire Department and the Vernon County Sheriff's Department to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to both people and the environment.  The primary activity at the facility is the storage and transfer of fertilizers.  

Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Sheldon has implemented the provisions of ANSI K-61 and OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111.  OSHA, EPA, DOT and the Missouri Department of Agriculture regularly inspect our facilities.  These inspections along with the safety culture and training our employees have been through have helped us achieve an outstanding safety record.  Our employees receive semi-annual on the job training and must be able to demonstrate safe handling procedures before working with anhydrous ammonia.  Employees at this facility also receive certified training from the Fertilizer and Chemical Association.

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years in excess of a reportable quantity as established by the above listed agencies. 

Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Sheldon has a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA and the EPA and we report our regulated materials to the Community Right to Know program, the responding Fire Department and the Local Emergency Response Commission.  Our safety practices go beyond what the rules require, we do what is good for business and safe for the community and environment.
